New Records: Tristan Stubbs scored his first ODI century and hit 112 off 81 balls
Key Match Events: Tristan Stubbs' unbeaten 112 off 81 balls was the game-changer for South Africa
Ireland's bowling unit put in a collective effort to keep South Africa's momentum in check
Paul Stirling and Andrew Balbirnie will be key in providing a solid foundation for Ireland's chase
Pre-Game Insights: Temba Bavuma emphasized how the wicket looked good and it looked a bit on the drier side
Kyle Verreynne reflected on the team's recent form, emphasizing how the tough series against Afghanistan pushed them to reform their approach as a batting unit
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Verreynne believes it's a strong total and that the team's goal is to finish the game with a convincing margin
South Africa head into the break with a commanding total, leaving Ireland with a steep chase ahead
Miscellaneous Highlights: The wicket played a bit slower, which led South Africa to focus on using the square boundaries effectively with flicks and punches
The extra pace under the lights assisted South Africa's bowlers
